speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Scully? Can I see you for a few minutes?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Kimberly would you excuse us please?

speaker: KIMBERLY (THE SECRETARY)
line: Certainly sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: A memo came across my desk last night. I debated whether or not to call you at home but I decided to..

speaker: SCULLY
line: And it concerns me?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Yes, and your sister. It's been 5 months and there have been no leads or new evidence on her murder investigation by the DC police team or the Bureau. I've been told the case is to remain inactive until further notice.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I see.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I don't think there's anything to be read into this. I think it's a case of manpower and workload. I want you to know that I am going to appeal this decision and I am gonna go back over all the evidence again myself and make sure that nothing has been overlooked.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You know, it's strange. Men can blow up buildings, and they can be nowhere near the crime scene but we can piece together the evidence and convict them beyond a doubt. Our labs here can recreate out of the most microscopic detail the motivation and circumstance to almost any murder, right down to a killer's attitude towards his mother and that he was a bed wetter. But in a case of a woman, my sister, who was gunned down in cold blood in a well-lit apartment building by a shooter who left the weapon at the crime scene, we can't even put together enough to keep anybody interested.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I don't think this has anything to do with interest.

speaker: SCULLY
line: If I may say so sir, it has everything to do with interest. Just not yours, and not mine.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sorry I'm late.

speaker: MULDER
line: Anything up?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. It's nothing. What did you want to talk to me about?

speaker: MULDER
line: Something interesting came into my attention last night. A French salvage ship, the Piper Maru, limped into port in San Diego yesterday, all the way from the north Pacific.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why is that of interest?

speaker: MULDER
line: Using the national weather service satellite system, I was able to track its course. This was its original position.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Longitude uh.. 171 east, latitude 42 north.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, that's where the boat we know as The Talapus pulled up what you believe was a Russian sub, but what I believe was the remains of a UFO.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder...

speaker: MULDER
line: Look Scully, I don't know what it is but something is still down there and now the French are looking for it too.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So what?

speaker: MULDER
line: So why all the attention paid to this site? What information are they acting on?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why don't you just ask them?

speaker: MULDER
line: I would but the entire crew is being treated for radiation burns.

speaker: SCULLY
line: From exposure to what?

speaker: MULDER
line: The French government is keeping that information classified for some reason.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Could it have anything to do with their resumption in nuclear tests?

speaker: MULDER
line: I checked. It's thousands of miles away from any test sites. What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm just constantly amazed by you.. you're working down here in the basement, sifting through files and transmissions that any other agent would just throw away in the garbage.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well that's why I'm in the basement Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're in the basement because they're afraid of you, of your relentlessness and because they know that they could drop you in the middle of the desert, and tell you the truth is out there, and you would ask them for a shovel!

speaker: MULDER
line: Is that what you think of me?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, maybe not a shovel. Maybe a backhoe.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well that's good because there's some garbage in San Diego I want you to help me dig through.

speaker: MULDER
line: Dr Seizer?

speaker: MULDER
line: Special agent Mulder. This is agent Scully.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, how are they doing? to determine a proper course of treatment, because there's an air of secrecy around what happened. The source of their exposure is still undetermined.

speaker: SCULLY
line: These symptoms, would you characterize then as acute or somatic? I'm a medical doctor. it. The effects are degrading rapidly, spontaneous internal bleeding in the mouths and intestinal tracts , blood in the urine. All these men are suffering severe delirium, the pre-advanced stages of coma.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What kind of exposure are we talking about here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's verging on the levels of victims of Hiroshima suffered. like this just don't appear in nature.

speaker: MULDER
line: Not on this planet.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you get the chance to talk to any of them? for one man, and this was strange because he's the only one who seems to be completely unaffected. I held him for the 1st day, but I detected none of the symptoms of the others. His leukocytes and erythocytes were high. Actually, he was in very good health.

speaker: MULDER
line: How could that be? With that level of radiation, how could one man not be exposed? was the one who piloted the boat in. And none of these men could've done that in their condition.

speaker: MULDER
line: Could it be possible for us to talk to him? He's a Frenchman, has a San Francisco address, his name is Gauthier.

speaker: A MAN'S VOICE
line: Ok let's wrap it up and get in the trucks. home number.

speaker: MULDER
line: Try the INS or the French Consulate, see what you can pull up on him. Consulate please?

speaker: MULDER
line: Agents Mulder and Scully, FBI.

speaker: MAN
line: I'm Wayne Morgan. I'm with the uh Navy's investigative services unit.

speaker: MULDER
line: Have you turned anything up?

speaker: MORGAN
line: No nothing, but I'm not exactly sure what I'm supposed to be looking for.

speaker: MULDER
line: The crew of this ship is being treated for radiation.

speaker: MORGAN
line: Yeah we got all that, we had hazmat team poring over the boat, didn't find a trace.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Nothing?

speaker: MORGAN
line: We have divers in the water going over the hull, put probes down the bilge. Couldn't detect the slightest level.

speaker: MULDER
line: So it's ok for us to go on board?

speaker: MORGAN
line: Sure, you'll probably get more radiation off your cell phone. ON THE BOAT

speaker: MORGAN TO SCULLY
line: Generator's back, is that better?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, thanks. Is this the way you found this room?

speaker: MORGAN
line: Nothing's been touched, not since you've been tied up here anyway. It's a mess huh?

speaker: MULDER
line: Feels like home.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It feels like somebody was looking for something, any idea what?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I'm looking for the vcr.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What for?

speaker: MULDER
line: The dive suit has a video camera.

speaker: MORGAN
line: What the hell is that?

speaker: MULDER
line: Looks like the fuselage of a plane.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's a North American P-51 Mustang.

speaker: MORGAN
line: Yeah it sure is.

speaker: MULDER
line: I just got very turned on.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's the shape of the canopy. I used to watch my father and brothers put together World War II model planes as a kid.

speaker: MULDER
line: Would it have been carrying anything radioactive?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No it was just a fighter.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then what was it those men exposed to?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know, but I might know somebody I can ask.

speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE
line: You're home! I was so worried about you. Why didn't you call me? There were these men from the consulate, they said there've been an accident...Why aren't you answering me? Why aren't you answering me?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi, I'm here to see Commander Johansen.

speaker: MILITARY
line: Name please?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Special agent Dana Scully, FBI.

speaker: MILITARY
line: You have an appointment?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, uh.. he used to be a friend of my father's. I'm out here from Washington and I wanted to surprise him.

speaker: MILITARY
line: Let me give you directions.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know my way, thanks.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mr Gauthier? Mr Gauthier? open the door, it's the FBI. Mr Gauthier?

speaker: MULDER
line: Mr Gauthier? I want you to lie still. I'm with the FBI. What happened?

speaker: GAUTHIER
line: Just fall, I don't know.

speaker: MULDER
line: How did you get here?

speaker: GAUTHIER
line: I can't remember. I was on the boat.

speaker: MULDER
line: The Piper Maru? That's the last thing you remember?

speaker: GAUTHIER
line: Yes, I was on the dive.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you know where you are?

speaker: GAUTHIER
line: I'm at home.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: GAUTHIER
line: Where's my wife?

speaker: MULDER
line: Nobody else's home, but somebody has been going over your papers.

speaker: GAUTHIER
line: Where's Joan?

speaker: MULDER
line: She's not here, look.. you need to be careful, you have some kind of oil all over you?

speaker: GAUTHIER
line: What's going on here?

speaker: MULDER
line: I want you to remain calm, ok? I'd like to ask you a few questions about a letter. About a J. Kallenchuk Salvage Brokers.

speaker: GAUTHIER
line: I don't recognize that name.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, somebody did. And I think you know why.

speaker: GAUTHIER
line: I would like to speak with the French Consul General. I have nothing more to say.

speaker: OLD MAN
line: Yes?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Commander Johansen?

speaker: JOHANSEN
line: Yes?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm Dana Scully, I used to live 3 doors down. My father was Captain William Scully. I went to school with your son..

speaker: JOHANSEN
line: I'm sorry.. my memory isn't quite what it used to be. Richard doesn't live here anymore.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Actually sir, I came to see you. I work for the FBI now and there's a question I'm hoping you can answer.

speaker: JOHANSEN
line: Um.. well would you come in. Do sit down.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you.

speaker: JOHANSEN
line: Would you like something to drink?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No thank you. I know that you were an officer in the Pacific during World War II. I wanted to ask you about a plane that's been discovered.

speaker: JOHANSEN
line: Discovered?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, a P-51 Mustang at the bottom of the Pacific Ocean with the uh..call numbers JTT0 111470.

speaker: JOHANSEN
line: Well those are not the call numbers of a P-51.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There was an illustration on the fuselage with the words "Drop Dead Red".

speaker: JOHANSEN
line: I'm .. sorry.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Would the words Zeus Faber mean anything to you?

speaker: JOHANSEN
line: No.. but as I said, sometimes my memory is not so sharp.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well would you know anybody I might be able to talk to? Somebody who might be able to give me that information?

speaker: JOHANSEN
line: I wish I could help you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I wish you could too. There's a number of French sailors who may die from radiation exposure. If we knew more about the plane, we might be able to understand why. Anyway.. it was very good to see you again sir.

speaker: JOHANSEN
line: Oh say hello to your father for me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I wish I could, he's passed away.

speaker: JOHANSEN
line: I'm very sorry.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I have to say this place brings back memories for me. I remember all the kids used to play a game called beckons wanted, right out there. Well.. if you talk to your son, will you tell him I stopped by? Thank you.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Who is it?

speaker: MULDER
line: My name is Mulder, I'm with the FBI.

speaker: WOMAN
line: It's open. Can I help you?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm looking for Mr Kallenchuk.

speaker: WOMAN
line: I'm sorry Mr Kallenchuk is out of town, perhaps I can help you with something?

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe you can tell me where I could find him.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Sure, the Far East.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well I've got a letter here typed on his stationary. Maybe you typed it for him.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Sorry I don't type. What did you say your name was again?

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Mr Mulder I'd be happy to relay any messages you have for him, but I really have no way of contacting Mr Kallenchuk just now.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ok well, why don't you have him call me as soon as he can.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Sure, the FBI.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes, what did you say your name was?

speaker: WOMAN
line: Geraldine.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thank you Geraldine.

speaker: MILITARY
line: Agent Scully, would you step off the car please?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why?

speaker: MILITARY
line: Turn off your engine and step off the car please.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's this about?

speaker: MILITARY
line: You're being detained .

speaker: JOHANSEN
line: Pull over there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's going on?

speaker: JOHANSEN
line: I can't give your regards to my son, Miss Scully, he was killed in a training accident during the Gulf War.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry...there's something else, isn't there?

speaker: JOHANSEN
line: We bury our dead alive, don't we?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know if I understand.

speaker: JOHANSEN
line: We hear them everyday, they talk to us, they haunt us, they beg us for meaning. Conscience... it's just the voices of the dead.. trying to save us from our own damnation.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You know something about that plane don't you?

speaker: JOHANSEN
line: I know because, I was sent to find it.. as an officer in a submarine, called the Zeus Faber.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, it's me, where are you?

speaker: MULDER
line: San Francisco airport, where are you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Miramar Airbase. I think I've just found out what those men were exposed to, what the Piper Maru was out there looking for.

speaker: MULDER
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That P-51 Mustang was part of an escort for a B-20 carrying an atomic bomb, just like the one we dropped on Hiroshima. Only this one never reached its target.

speaker: MULDER
line: Says who?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Says one of the men originally sent to find it, on a submarine called the Zeus Faber.

speaker: MULDER
line: That was the name we saw written on that dive chart right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It all makes sense Mulder, why would they build a nuclear weapon when they can salvage one?

speaker: MULDER
line: Why if they knew about it, why wait 50 years to try to recover it? And why was the only person not exposed, the diver, sent down to find it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why don't you try to find out?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What about you?

speaker: MULDER
line: I gotta go to Hong Kong.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hong Kong?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, look, uh.. I'm gonna miss my flight, so uh... I gotta call you back ok?

speaker: WAITRESS
line: Hi.

speaker: MIB#1
line: Anything good here? Anything not on the menu?

speaker: SKINNER
line: You'll have to ask the waitress. You gentleman have a problem?

speaker: MIB#1
line: When something is not on the menu Mr Skinner, there's usually a reason, wouldn't you say?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm sorry I didn't came here for conversation.

speaker: MIB#2
line: A hierarchy exists in the FBI, isn't that right? A man has status, like yourself, you're assistant director, those under him obey his orders, right?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Who are you guys?

speaker: MIB#1
line: We work with the intelligence community.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Remind me not to move there.

speaker: MIB#1
line: You take your orders like those below you, Mr Skinner. A case is made inactive, the death of an FBI agent's sister, maybe that's because those above you have done the hard work of arriving at that decision.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Thanks for the enlightenment, I'm gonna go now.

speaker: MIB#1
line: It helps to know these things when a man looks forward to his career, to his plan for future.

speaker: JOHANSEN
line: We'd all joined thinking we'd come home heroes. That's me. The rest of the men of the picture...a month later they were all dead. The madness we planned to unleash on the Japanese...we ended up setting it loose on ourselves.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Radiation killed all those men?

speaker: JOHANSEN
line: The men you say had burns on their bodies.. that's how it began with us. Awful burns. destroyer moved into the area.. but rather than attempt to return home, Captain Sanford ordered us to go to silent running. After 3 days the burns started to appear. Baker got them first, then Vorce and Innocenti. No one had seen burns like these before. But a lot of us began to suspect they had to do with the planes that we'd been sent to recover. The men were all frightened to die. As the X.O. I urged the captain to return to port but against all reason and good sense, he refused to leave the area.

speaker: MAN
line: Captain Sanford, I'm not an MD but I know a lost cause when I see one, these men are all dying and there's nothing that I can do to stop it.

speaker: SANFORD
line: Just do your damn job.

speaker: MAN
line: Sir I'm trying, but if we stay down here any longer, none of us are going home.

speaker: MAN (WHISPERING)
line: Johansen, you've gotta get us to the surface .

speaker: JOHANSEN
line: We are under the captain's orders.

speaker: MAN
line: He's losing his mind.

speaker: JOHANSEN
line: The Japanese are shadowing us. That destroyer is doing wide circles above our position.

speaker: MAN
line: You have to take control of this sub sir, you have to make a decision.

speaker: ANOTHER MAN'S VOICE
line: We're all gonna die! All of us, we're dying, can't you all see that? You've gotta get us outta here the only command that could save us from the Japanese destroyer now was the command to return home, an order I knew the captain would never issue..

speaker: SANFORD
line: Johansen! Open this door! Open this door! Johansen!

speaker: JOHANSEN (VOICE OVER)
line: I knew mutiny was our only chance for survival. But I also knew, by sealing that door, I was sealing the fate of the men I locked behind it.

speaker: JOHANSEN
line: By luck, or the grace of God, we made it to Pearl Harbor.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What happened to Sanford and the sick crew men?

speaker: JOHANSEN
line: When they opened that door, those who weren't dead were dying. There were 144 men on that boat, only 7 of us had survived. Whatever killed then, I was allowed to live, to raise a family, to grow old. None of us never got an explanation why.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is this seat taken Miss Kallenchuk? Geraldine Kallenchuk, isn't it?

speaker: GERALDINE
line: Jerry, with a J.

speaker: MULDER
line: I noticed you flew 1st class, must be good money selling classified government secrets.

speaker: GERALDINE
line: It's a bull market, hon, and I'm Miss Popular. Let's make a deal.

speaker: MULDER
line: How much for the location of that P-51 Mustang you sold the French government?

speaker: GERALDINE
line: Why should I tell you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Actually I'd rather know who sold you the secret.

speaker: GERALDINE
line: I'm a middle man Mr Mulder, pardon my gender type. I take a cut, then slice off the top. It would be bad business to divulge my sources.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why did you run off to Hong Kong?

speaker: GERALDINE
line: To meet the buyer.

speaker: MULDER
line: To sell him what?

speaker: GERALDINE
line: Pardon your gender type.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh your buyer's a woman.

speaker: GERALDINE
line: Actually you know, it's none of your damn business.

speaker: MULDER
line: Actually you know it is my damn business because whatever you're selling is killing half a dozen sailors in a California Hospital. Which is why I'm gonna arrest you.

speaker: GERALDINE
line: Arrest me? With what? Your chopsticks? This is Hong Kong Mr Mulder, they don't allow handguns here, they took yours away.. at the airport. Hey! Hey! You can't do that!

speaker: MULDER
line: I just did it, now let's make a deal.

speaker: GERALDINE
line: You are violating my civil rights.

speaker: MULDER
line: You gave up your civil rights when you committed treason.

speaker: GERALDINE
line: You can't force me to do anything.

speaker: MULDER
line: Open it. Pardon my gender type, but after you. Where are the lights?

speaker: MAN'S VOICE
line: Right here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Krycek. I thought guns were against the law here.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: You know what they say when guns are outlawed...

speaker: MULDER
line: Why don't you take that gun and shoot yourself in your head like you shot my father?

speaker: GERALDINE
line: Great.. High Noon in Hong Kong.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Aw... why don't you SHUT UP!

speaker: GERALDINE
line: My God!

speaker: MULDER
line: It's no way to treat your business partner, especially since she's been moving those secrets you've been selling so well.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Looks like she's your partner now.

speaker: MULDER
line: Damn.

speaker: MAN'S VOICE
line: Au fond a gauche. Allez on s'depeche, on s'depeche. Il est parti. Allez on s'depeche vite, allez les gars on y va.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Is the coffee hot?

speaker: WAITRESS
line: Yeah.

speaker: SKINNER
line: How's the blue plate?

speaker: WAITRESS
line: Looks good.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'll have one medium rare please. phone that's out of order nobody complains? I'm complaining.

speaker: WAITRESS
line: I'm sorry sir, I'm sure it's been called in.

speaker: MAN
line: You're sure? Meanwhile, I'm going to miss the phone call. That's gonna cost me time and money..Who's gonna call that in?

speaker: WAITRESS
line: I'm sorry, sir, I don't know what else to say.

speaker: MAN
line: Say you're gonna pay me.. the 1.75 the phone ate.

speaker: WAITRESS
line: No you'll have to deal with the phone company sir.

speaker: MAN
line: You'll deal with 'em, I want my money.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Is there a problem there?

speaker: MAN
line: Yeah there is a big problem.

speaker: MAN
line: Chupa dura , amigo.

speaker: WAITRESS
line: Oh my god! I'll call 911.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Scully.

speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE
line: Agent Scully, this is Kim Cook from the director's office.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes.

speaker: KIM
line: We've just got some bad news, AD Skinner has just been shot.

speaker: SCULLY
line: When?

speaker: KIM
line: About an hour ago, he's been taken to Northeast Georgetown.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm on my way.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's for your partner. This is for me And this is for my father

speaker: KRYCEK
line: No! I didn't kill your father.

speaker: MULDER
line: Now you tell me.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: It wasn't me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh yeah? Then who was it?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: I don't know, don't know.

speaker: MULDER
line: Either way Krycek you're a liar.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Come on, finish it Mulder, c'mon finish it, come on.

speaker: MULDER
line: I want that digital tape.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: I don't have it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Like hell you don't, it contains the secrets you were selling as well as everything else our government knows about the existence of extra terrestrial life .

speaker: KRYCEK
line: How could I sell anything? The tape's encrypted.

speaker: MULDER
line: Obviously, you found a way.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: I don't have it...I'll give it to you if you let me go.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where is it?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: DC... in a locker. No. If you let me go, I'll tell you.

speaker: MULDER
line: You put that tape in my hands and we'll talk about it. Why don't you go to the bathrooms and clean yourself off? If you're not out of there in 3 minutes, I'm coming in there to kill you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Feel better?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Like a new man.
